title: Pregnancy Resources
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

content: This listing is provided for your reference. It is not a complete list of available resources.
The information and opinions provided by these organizations are not necessarily those of WebMD.

content_blocks.text: This listing is provided for your reference. It is not a complete list of available resources.
The information and opinions provided by these organizations are not necessarily those of WebMD.

sections.heading: Mother's Health
content: American Congress of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG) Resource Center (800) 673-8444 www.acog.org
American Diabetes Association 800- DIABETES
800-342-2383 www.diabetes.org
Parent's Guide to Cord Blood Foundation www.parentsguidecordblood.org
Group B-Strep International 909 620-7214 www.groupbstrepinternational.org
Lamaze International 202-367-1128 www.lamaze.org
Maternal and Child Health Bureau, Health Resources and Services Administration (MCHB): Information on a variety of maternity topics mchb.hrsa.gov

Miscarriage, Stillbirth, Infant Death and Pregnancy Complications , University of Kansas Medical Center - Genetics Center: Offers a variety of resources for grieving parents and children www.kumc.edu/gec/support/miscarri.html
Motherisk: Offers information about risks to pregnant and new mothers 877-439-2744 www.motherisk.org
Planned Parenthood Federation of America: Offers information on family planning 800-230-7526 www.plannedparenthood.org
Hope for Two...The Pregnant With Cancer Network 800-743-4471 www.pregnantwithcancer.org
Sidelines National Support Network: Offers information about high-risk pregnancy 888-447-4754 www.sidelines.org
The National Women's Health Information Center, U.S. Department of Health and Human Services 800-994-9662 www.womanshealth.gov
